Content Creator Job at Owens and Xley Consults




        
    

        
        Owens and Xley Consults - Our client, a curated gifting and lifestyle shop in Lekki, Lagos State, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

About the Role


	Create engaging content, develop strategies, and collaborate with the marketing team.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Create and curate compelling content
	Develop social media strategies
	Collaborate with marketing and creative teams
	Manage paid social media campaigns
	Analyze performance metrics


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field
	2+ years of experience in social media management
	Strong understanding of social media platforms and analytics tools


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: recruitment@owensxley.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Don't apply if you lack the required experience. Only candidates meeting the qualifications will be considered.

  "description": "Propetrol Limited is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Executive Management
Department: EPC (Engineering, Procurement, &amp; Construction)

Job Summary


	We are looking for an experienced Procurement Manager to lead strategic sourcing, supplier management, and procurement execution across diverse and complex operations, including marine logistics, oil &amp; gas, engineering &amp; construction (EPC) and renewable energy.
	This role requires a commercially savvy, compliance-driven, and detail-oriented professional with a proven track record of optimizing procurement functions in technically demanding environments.
	The ideal candidate brings a global perspective, excellent negotiation skills, and the ability to support project success across the value chain.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Procurement Leadership:


	Lead procurement planning and execution for major EPC and renewable energy projects, marine logistics operations, and oil &amp; gas value chains.
	Develop category strategies and sourcing plans for technical equipment, services, and capital projects.
	Conduct spend analysis, market research, and supplier risk assessments to drive cost efficiency and supply chain resilience.


Project &amp; Technical Sourcing:


	Oversee technical procurement of critical spares, MRO materials, vessel parts, and oilfield equipment.
	Manage procurement for solar, wind, and hybrid energy installations, as well as plant construction, pipelines, and infrastructure.
	Support vessel acquisition, dry-docking, and towage operations including logistics, permits, and port formalities.


Supplier &amp; Contract Management:


	Negotiate and manage contractual agreements using standards such as NSF2012, FIDIC, and TOWCON/TOWHIRE.
	Evaluate and onboard global suppliers, ensuring compliance with quality, safety, and ESG standards.
	Monitor supplier performance and implement continuous improvement initiatives.


Process, Compliance &amp; Reporting:


	Manage the full procure-to-pay (P2P) process using ERP systems such as Oracle, EPICOR, and SAP.
	Track procurement KPIs including cost savings, vendor performance, cycle times, and payment terms.
	Ensure strict compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and international trade rules.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, Procurement, or related technical field.
	10+ years of procurement experience across EPC, renewable energy, oil &amp; gas, and logistics sectors.
	Proven success in managing high-value, technical procurement projects in upstream, downstream, and green energy domains.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of energy project sourcing, international procurement, and local content compliance.
	Expertise in contract negotiation, vendor development, and supplier performance management.
	Familiarity with global procurement protocols and documentation, including INCOTERMS and import/export regulations.
	Proficient in tools like Oracle, EPICOR, SAP or IVALUA.
	Excellent stakeholder management, analytical, and leadership skills.


Preferred Certifications:


	
	CIPS, PMP, or equivalent procurement/project management certifications.
	


Why Join Us?


	Salary: N120,000 - N300,000 Monthly.
	Be part of a forward-thinking team transforming energy and infrastructure across Africa and beyond. We offer a collaborative work culture, competitive compensation, and exciting projects that challenge the status quo.

Procurement Manager Job at Propetrol Limited

Job Position: Procurement Manager
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Executive Management
Department: EPC (Engineering, Procurement, & Construction)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for an experienced Procurement Manager to lead strategic sourcing, supplier management, and procurement execution across diverse and complex operations, including marine logistics, oil & gas, engineering & construction (EPC) and renewable energy.
	This role requires a commercially savvy, compliance-driven, and detail-oriented professional with a proven track record of optimizing procurement functions in technically demanding environments.
	The ideal candidate brings a global perspective, excellent negotiation skills, and the ability to support project success across the value chain.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Procurement Leadership:


	Lead procurement planning and execution for major EPC and renewable energy projects, marine logistics operations, and oil & gas value chains.
	Develop category strategies and sourcing plans for technical equipment, services, and capital projects.
	Conduct spend analysis, market research, and supplier risk assessments to drive cost efficiency and supply chain resilience.


Project & Technical Sourcing:


	Oversee technical procurement of critical spares, MRO materials, vessel parts, and oilfield equipment.
	Manage procurement for solar, wind, and hybrid energy installations, as well as plant construction, pipelines, and infrastructure.
	Support vessel acquisition, dry-docking, and towage operations including logistics, permits, and port formalities.


Supplier & Contract Management:


	Negotiate and manage contractual agreements using standards such as NSF2012, FIDIC, and TOWCON/TOWHIRE.
	Evaluate and onboard global suppliers, ensuring compliance with quality, safety, and ESG standards.
	Monitor supplier performance and implement continuous improvement initiatives.


Process, Compliance & Reporting:


	Manage the full procure-to-pay (P2P) process using ERP systems such as Oracle, EPICOR, and SAP.
	Track procurement KPIs including cost savings, vendor performance, cycle times, and payment terms.
	Ensure strict compliance with company policies, industry regulations, and international trade rules.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, Procurement, or related technical field.
	10+ years of procurement experience across EPC, renewable energy, oil & gas, and logistics sectors.
	Proven success in managing high-value, technical procurement projects in upstream, downstream, and green energy domains.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of energy project sourcing, international procurement, and local content compliance.
	Expertise in contract negotiation, vendor development, and supplier performance management.
	Familiarity with global procurement protocols and documentation, including INCOTERMS and import/export regulations.
	Proficient in tools like Oracle, EPICOR, SAP or IVALUA.
	Excellent stakeholder management, analytical, and leadership skills.


Preferred Certifications:


	
	CIPS, PMP, or equivalent procurement/project management certifications.
	


Why Join Us?


	Salary: N120,000 - N300,000 Monthly.
	Be part of a forward-thinking team transforming energy and infrastructure across Africa and beyond. We offer a collaborative work culture, competitive compensation, and exciting projects that challenge the status quo.

  "title": "Company Secretary",
  "description": "Ocean Lord Limited&nbsp;is a Nigeria?based conglomerate specializing in frozen seafood and related goods.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Company Secretary
Job Location:&nbsp;Ibafo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are hiring a diligent and well-organized Company Secretary to handle administrative and compliance tasks, support the executive team, and ensure smooth corporate operations.
	This position requires someone with strong communication skills, attention to detail, and a good understanding of corporate governance.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain statutory records and file regulatory documents
	Prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and board resolutions
	Manage company correspondence and legal documentation
